qas.question: The remains of what was found at Sepphoris?
Who were the primary inhabitants of Sepphoris in the 3rd through 7th centuries?
The mosaic found at Sepphoris display a mix of Jewish and which beliefs?
What figure is dominant in the mosaic at Sepphoris?
What surrounds Helios in the mosaic at Sepphoris?

context: The remains of <a0_0>a 6th-century synagogue<a0_0/> have been uncovered in Sepphoris, which was an important centre of Jewish culture between the 3rd–7th centuries and a multicultural town inhabited by <a1_0>Jews<a1_0/>, Christians and pagans. The mosaic reflects an interesting fusion of Jewish and <a2_0>pagan<a2_0/> beliefs. In the center of the floor the zodiac wheel was depicted. <a3_0>Helios<a3_0/> sits in the middle, in his sun chariot, and each zodiac is matched with <a4_0>a Jewish month<a4_0/>. Along the sides of the mosaic are strips depicting Biblical scenes, such as the binding of Isaac, as well as traditional rituals, including a burnt sacrifice and the offering of fruits and grains.
